text: {{Infobox chef | name = Gary Rhodes OBE | image = Gary_Rhodes.jpg | caption = Rhodes in June 2006 | birth_date = | birth_place = London, England | death_date = | death_place = Dubai, United Arab Emirates | style = British cuisine | education = | ratings = | restaurants = Rhodes W1 Brasserie Rhodes 24 Rhodes Restaurant Arcadian Rhodes Rhodes D7 Rhodes at the Dome | television = Gary Rhodes Autumn into Winter Gary Rhodes Spring into Summer Masterchef USA (2001) Masterchef UK (2000) New British Classics Nov/Dec Gary's Perfect Christmas Roald Dahl's Revolting Recipes Open Rhodes around Britain More Rhodes around Britain Rhodes around Britain Hot Chefs Rhodes Across India Rhodes Across China Rhodes Across the Caribbean | spouse = Jennie Rhodes (m. 1989) | children = 2 | prevrests = | awards = | website = }} Gary Rhodes, OBE (22 April 1960 â€“ 26 November 2019) was a British restaurateur and television chef. He was known for his love of British cuisine. He appeared on MasterChef, MasterChef USA, Hell's Kitchen, and his own series, Rhodes Around Britain. In 2006 he competed to represent the South of England in the BBC's Great British Menu, but lost to Atul Kochhar. Rhodes also had his own line of cookware and bread mixes. Rhodes went on to feature in the ITV1 programme Saturday Cooks, as well as the UKTV Food show Local Food Hero. Rhodes died on 26 November 2019 in Dubai at the age of 59. The cause of death was subdural haematoma.Gary Rhodes died from head injury, family confirms ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website. * Gary Rhodes at the British Film Institute. * .
